Key Match Events: Virat Kohli scored an unbeaten 82 off 53 balls
Hardik Pandya was bowled by Mohammad Nawaz in the final over
Dinesh Karthik was stumped by Mohammad Rizwan off Mohammad Nawaz
Arshdeep Singh removed Babar Azam lbw with his first ball in a T20 World Cup
Iftikhar Ahmed and Shan Masood built a partnership to take Pakistan to 159/8
India won by 4 wickets (with 0 balls remaining)
Pre-Game Insights: Experts predicted a close game between India and Pakistan
India's bowling attack was expected to be challenging for Pakistan's batsmen
Post-Match Reflections: Virat Kohli was emotional after the game, saying he had 'no words' for his innings
Rohit Sharma praised Kohli's innings, saying it was 'one of India's best knocks'
Arshdeep Singh was hailed as a hero for his crucial new-ball incisions and wicket of Babar Azam
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played in front of over 90,000 fans at the MCG
The pitch offered scary pace and seething bounce, making it challenging for batsmen
Spin was the price the match paid to be this awesome, with Arshdeep Singh and R Ashwin struggling to contain Pakistan's batsmen
Others: The match was a thrilling finish, with India needing 48 runs in the final three overs
Mohammad Nawaz's final over was a dramatic one, with Kohli launching him over the square-leg boundary and then getting bowled off a free hit
The umpires were involved in a long, animated, and emotional discussion over a no-ball call
